item.title: 英国央行 "滞胀 "预测令里夫斯受挫
item.description: 就在英国财政大臣公布一揽子提振经济的重大措施几天后，英国央行预计将在本周下调经济增长前景，并警告其 10 月份的预算将推高通胀，从而给蕾切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）造成打击。【原文：The Bank of England is expected to deal Rachel Reeves a blow this week by downgrading its growth outlook and warning that her October budget will drive up inflation just days after the Chancellor of the Exchequer unveiled a huge package of measures to boost the economy.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺因土地征用问题削减对南非的援助
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，美国将因南非的土地征用政策而停止向其提供援助，这引发了兰特的大跌。【原文：President Donald Trump said the US would stop sending aid to South Africa over its land expropriation policies, sparking a selloff in the rand.】

item.title: 特朗普的 "关税打击 "引发加拿大的危机反应
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普签署命令，对美国从加拿大购买的几乎所有商品征收 25% 的关税后，加拿大政府官员和商界领袖采取了与 Covid 大流行相似的危机应对措施。【原文：Canadian government officials and business leaders mounted a crisis response that drew parallels with the Covid pandemic after President Donald Trump signed an order to put 25% tariffs on almost everything the US buys from Canada.】

item.title: 墨西哥财政部长将在特朗普加征关税后与投资者会谈
item.description: 墨西哥财政部长罗赫略-拉米雷斯-德拉奥（Rogelio Ramirez de la O）将于周一召开投资者电话会议，此前美国总统唐纳德-特朗普下令对墨西哥出口商品征收25%的关税，导致比索在亚洲市场暴跌。【原文：Mexico’s finance chief Rogelio Ramirez de la O will host a conference call with investors on Monday after US President Donald Trump ordered 25% tariffs on exports from the country, sending the peso plunging in the Asian market.】

item.title: 特朗普关税引发全球市场动荡，黄金走高
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对来自加拿大、墨西哥和中国的进口商品全面征收关税，威胁称贸易战将刺激通胀并抑制全球经济增长，此后黄金在亚洲开盘时走高。【原文：Gold edged higher at the open in Asia after President Donald Trump imposed sweeping tariffs on imports from Canada, Mexico and China, threatening trade wars that will spur inflation and damp global growth.】

item.title: 特朗普关税计划引发贸易战，石油价格飙升
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对包括来自加拿大的原油在内的一系列进口商品征收高额关税，引发贸易战，导致石油价格飙升。【原文：Oil surged as President Donald Trump placed hefty tariffs on a range of imports including crude from Canada, ushering in a trade war.】

item.title: 美元大涨，股市将因特朗普关税而下跌：市场综述
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁从周二起对加拿大和墨西哥的商品征收 25% 的普遍税，对中国商品征收 10% 的普遍税，引发了报复誓言。【原文：The dollar surged in early Asian trading and stocks were primed for losses after US President Donald Trump carried out his threat to impose general levies of 25% on Canada and Mexico and 10% on Chinese goods from Tuesday, sparking vows of retaliation.】

item.title: 特朗普宣布加征关税后，加密货币首当其冲受到风险冲击
item.description: 周日晚些时候，加密货币的暴跌严重影响了美国一些投机性较强的数字资产，这表明在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收新关税之后，投资者将在周一开市时降低风险。【原文：A slump in cryptocurrencies weighed heavily on some of the more speculative digital assets late Sunday in the US, a sign investors will slash risk when markets open Monday following new tariffs imposed by Donald Trump.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 即使在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周六宣布征收广泛的进口关税之前，有关他将采取何种行动的猜测就已推动黄金创下自3月份以来的最大月度涨幅。与此同时，页岩开采活动正显示出放缓的迹象。即使在全球能源转型投资超过2万亿美元的情况下，以气候为重点的公司的融资交易仍在萎缩。【原文：Even before US President Donald Trump announced wide-ranging import tariffs on Saturday, speculation over what he would do had propelled gold to its biggest monthly gain since March. Meanwhile, shale patch activity is showing signs of slowing. And financing deals for climate-focused companies are shrinking even as global investment in the energy transition surpasses $2 trillion.】

item.title: 加拿大能源通过降低关税和海湾出口躲过一劫
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普下令降低原油税率，并可能让生产商完全避免对某些货物征税，加拿大的能源产业可能暂时躲过了与美国贸易战的灾难。【原文：Canada’s energy patch may have temporarily dodged disaster in the trade war with the US, with President Donald Trump’s orders taxing crude at a lower rate and possibly letting producers avoid levies altogether on some shipments.】

item.title: 关税战可能使加拿大陷入衰退
item.description: 顶级经济学家表示，加拿大经济将面临自 "科威德-19 "大流行病以来最严重的冲击，如果关税战持续下去，加拿大经济很可能陷入衰退，其中一位经济学家称这是一种 "生存威胁"。【原文：The Canadian economy is set to face the most severe shock since the Covid-19 pandemic and will probably sink into a recession if a tariff war persists, say top economists, with one calling it an “existential threat.”】

item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆表示，她将在周一早些时候宣布墨西哥政府抵御美国关税的 "B计划 "的细节。【原文：Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said she will announce early Monday the details of her government’s “Plan B” to defend the country against US tariffs.】

item.title: 新罕布什尔州丙烷价格将在关税早期影响下上涨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对从加拿大进口商品征收的关税可能很快就会在新英格兰地区以家庭供暖费上涨的形式体现出来。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s tariffs on imports from Canada may soon be felt in New England in the form of higher home-heating bills.】

item.title: 本田摩托车业务是混乱的日产联盟中的一颗宝石
item.description: 本田汽车公司（Honda Motor Co.）通过兼并日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co.）来支撑汽车销量的努力，可能会损害其公司中一个经常被人遗忘但同样重要的部分：蓬勃发展的摩托车业务。【原文：Honda Motor Co.’s crusade to shore up car sales by absorbing Nissan Motor Co. could undermine an oft-forgotten but equally vital part of its company: a thriving motorcycle business.】

item.title: 意大利联合信贷银行新入股意大利通用银行，意大利金融战升温
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）在争夺意大利金融体系主导权的斗争中出人意料地采取了新举措，公布了持有 Assicurazioni Generali SpA 少数股权的消息。【原文：UniCredit SpA has made a surprise new move in the fight to dominate the Italian financial system by unveiling a minority stake in Assicurazioni Generali SpA.】

item.title: 沙特-PIF 支持的麦加房地产开发商计划在当地上市
item.description: Umm Al Qura for Development & Construction Co.是穆斯林圣城麦加最大的项目之一，该项目背后的沙特阿拉伯公司计划在该国主要证券交易所进行首次公开募股。【原文：Umm Al Qura for Development & Construction Co., the Saudi Arabian firm behind one of the largest projects in the Muslim holy city of Mecca, plans to proceed with an initial public offering on the country’s main stock exchange.】

item.title: 特朗普关税重创汽车业，汽车价格将上涨 3,000 美元
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对加拿大和墨西哥征收的关税将威胁到北美地区汽车制造商的生产，并使创纪录的汽车价格进一步上涨，约四分之一万亿美元的贸易将受到干扰。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariffs against Canada and Mexico will threaten production at automakers across North America and send record vehicle prices even higher, with about a quarter of a trillion dollars in trade set to be disrupted.】

item.title: 科威特预测下一财政年度将出现 63 亿第纳尔赤字

item.title: 安大略省福特为应对关税将美国酒撤下货架
item.description: 加拿大最大的省份表示，作为对唐纳德-特朗普总统对加拿大进口商品征收 25% 关税的回应，该省将从政府经营的酒类商店中撤下美国产品。【原文：Canada’s biggest province said it will remove American products from its government-run liquor stores as part of its response to President Donald Trump’s 25% tariffs on Canadian imports.】

item.title: 欧盟警告美国，如果特朗普对商品征收关税，欧盟将进行报复
item.description: 欧盟表示，如果美国对欧盟征收关税，欧盟将 "坚决回应"，这是欧盟对唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易策略表示不满的最新迹象。【原文：The European Union has said it will “respond firmly” if the US imposes tariffs on the bloc in the latest sign of discontent with President Donald Trump’s trade tactics that are reverberating globally.】

item.title: 特朗普对中国征收 10%关税后，习近平考虑采取报复措施
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普挑起新一轮贸易战之后，加拿大和墨西哥领导人急忙做出回应，而中国国家主席习近平在宣布任何具体的报复措施之前，先喘了一口气。【原文：As the leaders of Canada and Mexico rushed to respond after Donald Trump started a new trade war, Chinese President Xi Jinping took a breath before his nation announced any concrete retaliation.】

item.title: 美元和美联储前景黯淡，新兴市场债务希望破灭
item.description: 由于美元走强和美国一系列关税措施，基金经理们重新考虑了他们对发展中资产的主要押注之一。【原文：What started as a promising year for emerging-market local debt is quickly souring as a strong dollar and a barrage of US tariffs have fund managers rethinking one of their main bets for developing assets.】
